ARR30-C.name: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts

ARR38-C.name: Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers

CON35-C.name: Avoid deadlock by locking in a predefined order

CON38-C.name: Preserve thread safety and liveness when using condition variables

CON43-C.name: Do not allow data races in multithreaded code

DCL55-CPP.name: Avoid information leakage when passing a class object across a trust boundary

DCL56-CPP.name: Avoid cycles during initialization of static objects

ENV32-C.name: All exit handlers must return normally

ERR00-J.name: Do not suppress or ignore checked exceptions

ERR33-C.name: Detect and handle standard library errors

ERR54-CPP.name: Catch handlers should order their parameter types from most derived to least derived

EXP37-C.name: Call functions with the correct number and type of arguments

EXP54-CPP.name: Do not access an object outside of its lifetime

FIO02-C.name: Canonicalize path names originating from tainted sources

FIO08-J.name: Distinguish between characters or bytes read from a stream and -1

FIO21-C.name: Do not create temporary files in shared directories

FIO30-C.name: Exclude user input from format strings

FIO34-C.name: Distinguish between characters read from a file and EOF or WEOF

FIO37-C.name: Do not assume that fgets() or fgetws() returns a nonempty string when successful

FIO39-C.name: Do not alternately input and output from a stream without an intervening flush or positioning call

FIO42-C.name: Close files when done with them

FIO45-C.name: Avoid TOCTOU race conditions while accessing files

FIO51-CPP.name: Always close files before a program terminates

INT32-C.name: Ensure that operations on signed integers do not result in overflow

INT33-C.name: Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors

MEM00-C.name: Allocate and free memory in the same module, at the same level of abstraction

MEM01-C.name: Store a new value in pointers immediately after free()

MEM31-C.name: Free dynamically allocated memory when no longer needed

MEM35-C.name: Allocate sufficient memory for an object

MEM36-C.name: Do not modify the alignment of objects by calling realloc()

MEM52-CPP.name: Detect and handle memory allocation errors

MEM55-CPP.name: Honor replacement dynamic storage management requirements

MSC12-C.name: Detect and remove code that has no effect or is never executed

MSC30-C.name: Do not use the rand() function for generating pseudorandom numbers

MSC33-C.name: Do not pass invalid data to the asctime() function

MSC37-C.name: Ensure that control never reaches the end of a non-void function

MSC50-CPP.name: Do not use std::rand() for generating pseudorandom numbers

MSC51-CPP.name: Ensure your random number generator is properly seeded

MSC52-CPP.name: Any value returning function must ensure all exit paths return a value

MSC54-CPP.name: A signal handler must be a plain old function

NUM02-J.name: Ensure that division and remainder operations do not result in divide-by-zero errors

OBJ14-J.name: Do not use an object that has been freed

POS02-C.name: Follow the principle of least privilege

POS34-C.name: Do not call putenv() with a pointer to an automatic variable as the argument

POS35-C.name: Avoid race conditions while checking for the existence of a symbolic link

POS36-C.name: Observe correct revocation order while relinquishing privileges

POS37-C.name: Ensure that privilege relinquishment is successful

POS39-C.name: Use the correct byte ordering when transferring data between systems

POS54-C.name: Detect and handle POSIX library errors

SIG30-C.name: Call only asynchronous-safe functions within signal handlers

SIG31-C.name: Do not access shared objects in signal handlers

STR02-C.name: Sanitize data passed to complex subsystems

STR07-C.name: Use the bounds-checking interfaces for string manipulation

STR31-C.name: Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator

STR32-C.name: Do not pass a non-null-terminated character sequence to a library function that expects a string

STR38-C.name: Do not confuse narrow and wide character strings and functions

STR50-CPP.name: Guarantee that storage for strings has sufficient space for character data and the null terminator
